content: The origins of the astrolabe are not well documented, but it is believed to have been invented in the Hellenistic world around 150 BCE. The exact inventor is unknown, but it is believed to have been developed by Greek astronomers and mathematicians. The astrolabe was later developed and improved upon by astronomers in the Islamic world, who made significant contributions to its design and use. The astrolabe then spread to Europe, where it became a popular tool for navigation and astronomy during the Renaissance.
